availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lycurgus M. Weaver (Harrison Co., Kentucky, wool carder, merchant, and private 1st Batt. Cav (csa))

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, wool carder, merchant, and soldier. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Henry H. Weaver and Drusilla Douglas Weaver. Resident of Harrison County in 1850. Wool carder in Harrison County in 1860. Enlisted in the 1st Battalion Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as private on October 20, 1861. Discharged due to disability on August 7, 1862. Merchant in Harrison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p.130B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 639.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0005.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 452.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #29938.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 324.
